question: Special Agent Eunice Bloom, 32 years old. Smecker plucked her right out of class at Quantico.
answer: Smecker hand picked her? Aw, man. This brawd's gonna be a nightmare.

question: She was assigned to OCD two years back. She can shoot a gun, set three course records during her training.
answer: Great. A bull dike, Annie Oakley wanna- be. We gotta get rid of her.

question: Naw...I'm in no condition. I'd just slow 'em down.
answer: Well, are ya at least gonna try ta talk them out of this? We don't even know what this is yet! Somebody could just be tryin' ta get away with murder here!

question: Aye. Only there's about a thousand easier ways ta do that. Trust me. Someone's callin' them out, Sibeal. Ya kill a priest in a church and make it look like they did it. Bring 'em back with a vengeance. Don't know who. Don't know why. But someone thinks he's real fuckin' clever. Only one problem with his little plan.
answer: What's dat?

question: It worked.
answer: Jesus Christ! D'er's too much we don't know and if you're won't at least try ta talk some sense into them, I will! Exactly what do you intend to do?

question: You see there's a "special" before my "agent." If we are going to address each other formally, I'd prefer if you popped it in there. Makes me feel, I don't know...special. Of course, I'd hoped we could be a little more personable. In fact, I'd like you to call me Eunice.
answer: O'kay, Eunice. I don't see why the fuck the Fed is...

question: Whoa, whoa, "fuck?" This isn't a "fuck" situation, is it? I can see a "God Damn" or two but why skip all the way to "fuck" right off the bat? Let's start slow and work our way up to it.
answer: What is the Fed's interest in this? The detectives harden, brick wall. Eunice furrows her brow.

question: Their interest, Detective, is capturing the men responsible for the murders of 22 of Boston's finest criminals. Y'see public perception is that these boys stepped in, did our jobs for us and then disappeared into thin air as we fecklessly searched for them. The FBI tends to take exception to such things. They coulda sent anyone. They sent me. Why do you think that is? It is because I am so fucking smart that I make smart people feel like retards. Now, we seem to be getting off on the wrong foot here. I'd appreciate a bit of cooperation. Let's chalk it up to paying respect to the memory of a dearly departed mutual friend. A man who taught me everything I know. Lovely. Now what's with the circus?
answer: The victim was killed late last night. When people gathered for morning mass, they found the front entrance chained and padlocked. A locksmith came out, cut the chain and surprise, surprise. Cell phones. Half of them called the cops. Half of them called the media. But regardless...word's out.

question: Very well, David. The Saints' signature stance. Copley Plaza Hotel four years ago. Two men of identical height put Yuri Petrova on his knees and each dropped iron to the back of his head. Eyes front, David. The position of the victim and the angles produced by the killers' stance created a unique scenario. The bullets criss crossed in the skull and exited the eye sockets. Here, this did not occur. The rounds moved on a straight trajectory through the back of the victim's head and out the front. Which happens when...
answer: ...one guy's holding two guns to the back of your head.

question: One guy. Now, the victim falls forward. If you please, David. The killer approached the body from the left side... ...and flipped him to the right.
answer: Left handed.

question: Yep, southpaw.
answer: But you said he was wicked short.

question: The Saints were later determined to be five foot eleven inches tall. It's just dumb luck that the Russian and McKinney are the exact same height. The rounds exited Petrova's eye balls. Here they came out the lower cheek. Three, four inches below the eyes.
answer: That puts him at five, seven-ish. That's not uncommonly short.

question: The prodigal son, huh? He wants us, he's fuckin' got us.
answer: But why would he do something so public?

question: Think about it. People figure we did it. Makes it more likely someone will drop a dime. Way easier to get to us in prison, isn't it, now.
answer: But how would anyone recognize us?

question: You don't remember those sketches on the news channel?
answer: Shit. That's right. Y'know, every time they show those composites on TV and then they catch the guy, it looks nothin' like him. But ours?

question: Just our luck. We get Leonardo fuckin' Divinci as a sketch artist.
answer: Maybe we should dye our hair.

question: What?
answer: Yeah. These guys are always dyin' their hair. You know, like in "The Fugitive." It's covert and shit.

question: What color would you dye it?
answer: I don't know...lighter, I guess.

question: Y'mean...blonde?
answer: I didn't say that!

question: California, surfer boy, gay, gay blonde?!
answer: I'm warnin' ya!

question: Just keep your hands off my ass back there and, "stay gold, Pony Boy."
answer: Fuck you!

question: AAAAAH! You motherfucker!
answer: Serves ya right!

question: But I got conex all over Bean Town. Romeo'll hook you up like a tow truck!
answer: No.

question: Why not?!
answer: We don't hafta give you reasons. Forget it.

question: You just scored a few points, Rome.
answer: Well, dust off my "Members Only" jacket. Cuz the kid has also supplied the ride!

question: I thought you said your car was inconspicuous.
answer: I don't like words that got 'spic' right in the middle. Besides, it is...where I live.

question: Where's that? Pimpville?
answer: Hey! I hail from a colorful people. Besides, you wouldn't know style if it pitched a tent in your ass! What do you think of the ride, Conman?

question: It's genius. I can even drive an F- lift, man. Got my class "D" license and everything.
answer: Now, dat's the spirit.

question: I need a gun. What the fuck? I'm in on this shit, man! I'm working here!
answer: You can consider yourself a fuckin' pledge until we say different.

question: Can I consider myself your girlfriend, too?
answer: That's what you get. Is there a problem?

question: Your boss, John Kuntsler called. Tells me you got a problem with authority.
answer: Absolute horse pucky, Chief. Unfortunately, authority's developed a problem with me.

question: And what's that?
answer: Well, y'see, I am currently in possession of a vagina.

question: Oh, Jeez, that's not...
answer: So you spoke to Kuntsler. Anything else.

question: If it's confirmed that the Saints are back and too many bodies start showing up with pocket change... ...he's gonna pull you and step in.
answer: Message delivered, Chief.

question: Shut up and get behind the fuckin' wheel!
answer: Well, at least the plan is off to a winning start.

question: Go fuck y'rself. It's heroin.
answer: How the fuck would you know?

question: Fuck you. I know shit.
answer: Jesus! What the fuck's he doin'?!

question: He can't see where he's goin'!
answer: Shit! Tell him to go left, now!

question: How are ya, lad? They call me...FUCK!...ASS!
answer: Nice to meet you, Fuck Ass, I'm Romeo.

question: The place used ta be an old speak easy in the forties. I only use it for storage, now.
answer: This is so fucking cool.

question: Nobody even knows it's up here. You'll be safe.
answer: You know what this is? This is our hide out, man! We got a hide out!

question: Oh, yeah. Someone's been eating their Wheaties. Yeah, get after it, girl. AAAAAH! WHAT THE FUCK!? You fucking bitch! Whoa, whoa, whoa.
answer: What did you just call me?

question: Who are you?
answer: Why, I'm a lady, George. That fact alone demands a certain amount of... ...cordiality.

question: I'm, I'm sorry I called you that.
answer: Well, how courteous of you to apologize. Courtesy is so important. Don't you agree?

question: Y, yeah...I'm with that.
answer: Good. Now sit your fat ass down. Where is...Concezio Yakavetta?

question: I don't know.
answer: Yeah. There's a lot of stuff you don't know, Hoss. For instance, why aren't you safely tucked away in some ivory tower with all the other big wigs, sucking on cannoli and shrimp cocktail? Why are you the one he left on the streets, George?

question: Someone's gotta run our legitimate businesses. Someone's gotta make sure that...
answer: Someone's gotta chum the waters.

question: That's bullshit and I ain't saying another fucking word to you.
answer: Good. Then you can just listen. The jig is up. We know Concezio had that priest killed. Oh, surprise, surprise. Another thing you don't know, I reckon. But why would he tell you? You and your guys on the streets, you're his bait. Y'all just got thrown into a meat grinder. Gorgeous George, huh? Expendable George is more like it. By the by, you got a pretty nice ass for a fat man.

question: Word is, Yakavetta's gunning for you boys hard. The whole city's on edge. I even heard he posted a reward like Jesse James style and shit. Any of his guys that take you out gets his palm crossed, two hundred and fifty grand.
answer: Whew. A quarter of a mill for us?

question: Us? What the fuck are you talking about "us?"
answer: Uncle, why do you have to disrespect me in front of them?!

question: Cool it, Mr. Big Shot! A year ago you were washing my pots and pans!
answer: Well, I don't wash fucking pots anymore! I'm part of this, Uncle!

question: Oh! Like the Roman Empire in here! Where's all the concubines and shit? I need to see the Boss, right away.
answer: Get over here!

question: Whoa! Uh. Hey, Boss! I just came by to...!
answer: Push the talk button, numb nuts.

question: Oh. Can you here me? Over.
answer: I can hear you fine, Smokey and the Bandit. Now, what the fuck are you doing here?

question: Everything's in motion. All our guys are gunning for these Jesus Freaks. I figure, no need for me to be on the streets no more. So, which room do I take, eh?
answer: You stupid motherfucker! I told you, you're on the streets till this is over! Now get the fuck outta here! And don't come back here till I tell you to, you fat fucking waste of space!

question: A priest. The sick fuck.
answer: And he leaves all of us on the streets holding the bag while him and his are living it up at the Taj fuckin' Majal, not a care in the world.

question: So, until the Saints get popped, we're all lambs to slaughter?
answer: Yeah! And he don't care how many of us they wipe out in the meantime!

question: What do you need me to do, Skipper?
answer: Spread the word to all the brugliones. No bullshit. From your mouth to their ears.

question: Everyone? North and South? That could get a little dicey.
answer: Fuck their old grudges. All of them are in this, like it or not. Tell them everything we discussed.

question: Even the panic room thing?
answer: Sure.

question: Good. That's a nice ice breaker. They'll get a kick outta that. I didn't even know those things were real. I thought they made that shit up for that movie? With that brawd and that kid? With those guys in that house?
answer: Panic Room?

question: Naw, the other one.
answer: Stop fuckin' around! This is serious shit, here! Tell 'em we meet tomorrow night. I'll call you with the location.

question: What the...did they use his mug shot?
answer: What? No.

question: You remember how he told us he was embarrassed cuz the guy had to hold up all his long hair behind his head?
answer: Aye.

question: Look at that. That's an arm.
answer: Oh...that's fuckin' harsh.

question: I don't know who it is. It's the truth! Concezio didn't tell no one what he was doing cuz he knew nobody would have o'kay'ed it! The shooter's an independent contractor! That's all I know!
answer: Where's Yakavetta hidin'?

question: The Prudential! Fortieth floor! Jesus Christ!
answer: You meeting someone tonight, George?

question: How do, David?
answer: Hey, DMV came up dry on the partial. INTERpol's still working it. Should only be another couple of hours.

question: Lovely. Anything else?
answer: Yeah. Nothing big. We just dumped a text message from George's cell. Just two words. "El Cava." It's a Mexican joint down by the docks. He sent it to his enforcer, Jo Jo Rhama. Guess gangsters gotta eat too, huh?

question: I think I'll drop in on their supper, see if I can shake them up a little.
answer: You need a body guard?

question: No thank you, Mike Tyson. Bye now.
answer: Bye. Oh, shit.

question: Very well...Connor, Murphy.
answer: Who the fuck was that guy?!

question: That, I suspect, was the shooter you boys have been looking for.
answer: Fucking...what the fuck?! Who the fuck is this brawd?! And what the fuck's going on, here?!

question: Let's speed this up before your new sidekick's got to dig any deeper into his impressive vocabulary.
answer: Oh, no you didn't.

question: This...simply won't do. We made a deal. The big fish step in if your body count gets too high and... ...you have been very naughty boys. O'kay. Here's how it all went down. A secret gathering of the Brugliones. The topic of discussion? Weak leadership and betrayal. The enemy of my enemy is my friend. So, even with all their old vendettas... And there it is. Guess what comes next. Red Rover. Red Rover. Ah. Easier uttered than accomplished. The North End and the South End may as well be the Hetfields and the McCoys. These fellas...they just don't get on. Oh, the cliche. A Mexican stand off in a Mexican restaurant. They cut each other to pieces...and nobody walked away. Who knows who fired first. Could have been any one of them. But somebody let it loose. And duck, duck, duck... Goose. Yakavetta's lost control of the streets. They're fighting over his throne. This was not the work of the Saints.
answer: INTERpol came through. You were right. Five foot five. Gotta be the shooter.

question: Are you ready for your fifteen minutes, Sweetheart?
answer: That ain't all. Short stuff's work visa was signed by a sponsor that doesn't exist and look at the date. Two months after Nine Eleven.

question: That's the guy. He's a Sicilian immigrant, name of Ottilio Panza.
answer: Five, five? He's short bastard isn't he?

question: Yes...and well put. He'll be front page news in the morning but we have to assume Yakavetta already knows we've ID'd his guy. We can't give him time to 'Plan B' us.
answer: We're hittin' him tomorrow night. Dat soon enough?

question: Nothing.
answer: Out with it! What the hell's the matter with ya?

question: Nothing! It's just...this is some heavy shit.
answer: Ya did fine at your uncle's place.

question: Special Agent Bloom! You are hereby relieved of all obligation to this investigation. That's right, kids. This crime scene is now under the full jurisdiction of your beloved federal government. As of now, you will all report to me, Special Agent John Kuntsler. Don't let us interrupt you. Just don't forget to turn over everything you find. We have people standing by ready to take credit for all your hard work. So, how ya doin', Bloomy?
answer: Just fine...Cunty.

question: Nice little science project you got going with these three goofballs. You trying to turn them into your own little junior G-men? Well, you can put sprinkles on shit, Bloom, but it's still shit. So, you and your Keystone Cops can all go home now and let the professionals handle this?
answer: Boy. I'd love to hear a gen-u-wine professional's assessment of a crime scene. How 'bout you, detectives?

question: O'kay. Seems pretty obvious. The door was broken down. We've got our point of entry. The assailants fired in this direction. Explains the windows. The victims were...
answer: There are three inaccuracies in what you just said. Number one, David.

question: Cuz, tonight...mamma's right on time. This evening's topic of discussion? Desperate times require desperate measures.
answer: Desperate times require...some, you know, some desperate shit. Starting tonight, every one of you fat fucking slobs is back on the streets and earning your daily bread. Shut the fuck up! We got no choice. You motherfuckers better get in touch with your 'inner gangster'. It's time to knock the dust off your ball bats! You break bones! You smash heads! You do whatever you gotta do!

question: Which brings us to the relevance of our new guests.
answer: Each one of you is to stick to the guy that called you here like glue. You arm yourselves to the teeth, pick your own crews. These bible banging psychos will make an attempt. It's your job to blow their souless hearts out of their chests.

question: It's time to reclaim the streets with an iron fist.
answer: We gotta take back what's ours with some sincere ironfistery.

question: Uh..."Take that, suckers!"
answer: Not cool enough.

question: Uh, "Merry Christmas, mother fuckers!"
answer: Too sacrilegious.

question: Oh God, uh, how about "Eat it!"
answer: What are we at, a buffet, now?

question: Good God, man! I'm a...
answer: Hang on, you might be onto something with the buffet thing, like with food, y'know? Let's brainstorm on that idea for a minute.

question: I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I wasn't gonna hurt you!
answer: You bet your ass you weren't.

question: Just lemme explain. I have information, like pertinent information. Ouch! Look, I was listening to you out there and that's, like, exactly what happened. That's what made me think you were the person to talk to.
answer: Yakavetta had a partner, didn't he.

question: Yeah.
answer: You saw this fella?

question: Yeah. It was only one time and just for a second but I think I could ID him. I don't know his name, though. Concezio always called him the "Old Man" accept one time when he called him something else, like he fucked up and I wasn't supposed ta hear it.
answer: What was it?

question: CONNOR! Son...Daddy's workin'. Where is he?
answer: Make me famous.

question: Where?
answer: FUCK YOU!!!

question: Can't wait ta ask him.
answer: Why didn't ya flip on him? Cut down yer time? The guy fucked ya.

question: I couldn't.
answer: Why the hell not?

question: He'd learned of the birth of my sons.
answer: Do you know Louie's full name?

question: Hello, Louie.
answer: Noah.

question: We haven't much time.
answer: My garden. She is beautiful, yes? Ah, but you. You are blind to beauty. You are a destroyer, Noah.

question: You know my reasons. You know why I did what I did.
answer: But do you? You think it was for your father? No. You were born a killer. Death...is in the very blood that runs through your veins.

question: No.
answer: Then explain this. You were not there to raise them. Not a single day. Yet, how closely they follow in the footsteps of their father. They have inherited your blood, Noah...your anger.

question: And you? What are you?
answer: I am a creator. You see? Our very natures stood in opposition as old as the story of the scorpion and the frog.

question: Why...did you sell me out, Louie?
answer: You can never understand.

question: 25 years....try me.
answer: I wanted to join with them. They were building an empire. Creating something and I was helping them! I used you, Noah, to eliminate their problems, to destroy their competition, to cut out their cancers. I earned my place among them.

question: Is this your place among them? Because all I see is a an old man, sitting in a garden.
answer: Alas, the scorpion and the frog both lost everything, yes? I should have paid more attention to the story. Without you...I was no longer useful to them. They cast me out!
